data.title: pleace hittest three param give default nullptr
data.body:
pleace hittest three param give default nullptr
when lua use the hittest, nil can not be use.

data.title: fixed bug that toggle can not work at first time
removing and adding from layer to node grid running a liquid action blackens sprite appearance
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.14
- devices test on: Iphone 5s
- developing environments
   - NDK version: 11.2.2725575
   - Xcode version: 8.2.1
   - VS version: N/A
   - browser type and version: N/A

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  create a sprite  with transparent image
2. add it to a layer
3. take that sprite remove it from the layer
4. create a node grid
5. add the node grid to a layer
6. add sprite to node grid
7. create and run liquid Action

data.title: fix error effect when button is clicked
EventListenerKeyboard not working on ios simulator
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version:3.14.1
- devices test on:ios simulator iphone6s plus /ios 9.3 (mac osx 10.12.3 (16D32))
- developing environments
   - Xcode version:Version 7.3.1 (7D1014)
Steps to Reproduce:

1. create a new lua project
2. add the following code to function MainScene:onCreate()
```lua
local listener = cc.EventListenerKeyboard:create()
    listener:registerScriptHandler(function (keyCode, event )
        print("get key event")
    end, cc.Handler.EVENT_KEYBOARD_RELEASED)
    local eventDispatcher = self:getEventDispatcher()
    eventDispatcher:addEventListenerWithSceneGraphPriority(listener, self)
```
3.just build and run and then press any key, nothing print in xcode's console

data.title: Improve js template and test pages
ActionManager 's functions are not virtual
data.body: Node::setActionManager is available to set a custom action manager, while ActionManager's functions are not virtual, users cannot deploy one with overridden methods.

data.title: WebSocket SSL crash in iOS
data.body:
I'm creating a game that uses WebSockets securely. When testing with some of the older iOS devices I see a crash in SSL. The crash always occurs in `WsThreadHelper::onSubThreadLoop` when calling `lws_service(__wsContext, 2);`.

The error is `EXC_BAD_ACCESS (code=EXC_ARM_DA_ALIGN, address=0x1f196574)`

Using a newer version of WebSocket.cpp from the `v3` branch.

Info:
- iOS Version 9.3.5
- iPad Mini MD528LL/A
- OpenSSL 1.1.0e
- libwebsocket 2.1.0

Crash Backtrace:
```
(lldb) bt
warning: could not load any Objective-C class information. This will significantly reduce the quality of type information available.
* thread #29: tid = 0xc925, 0x019e5c5c Chef Showdown Debug`bsaes_cbc_encrypt + 732, stop reason = EXC_BAD_ACCESS (code=EXC_ARM_DA_ALIGN, address=0x1f196574)
    frame #0: 0x019e5c5c Chef Showdown Debug`bsaes_cbc_encrypt + 732
    frame #1: 0x01abcd46 Chef Showdown Debug`tls1_enc + 1130
    frame #2: 0x01abc0d6 Chef Showdown Debug`ssl3_get_record + 732
    frame #3: 0x01abb29e Chef Showdown Debug`ssl3_read_bytes + 342
    frame #4: 0x01ac02fa Chef Showdown Debug`ssl3_read_internal + 124
    frame #5: 0x0106d4ea Chef Showdown Debug`lws_ssl_capable_read + 32
    frame #6: 0x01067d9c Chef Showdown Debug`lws_service_fd_tsi + 1012
    frame #7: 0x0106e7f8 Chef Showdown Debug`lws_plat_service_tsi + 318
  * frame #8: 0x0105a23c Chef Showdown Debug`cocos2d::network::WsThreadHelper::onSubThreadLoop(this=0x1bf06fd0) + 638 at WebSocket.cpp:412
    frame #9: 0x01059f6e Chef Showdown Debug`cocos2d::network::WsThreadHelper::wsThreadEntryFunc(this=0x1bf06fd0) + 62 at WebSocket.cpp:448
    frame #10: 0x010613c6 Chef Showdown Debug`void* std::__1::__thread_proxy<std::__1::tuple<void (cocos2d::network::WsThreadHelper::*)(), cocos2d::network::WsThreadHelper*> >(void*) [inlined] decltype(__f=0x1bdb77f0, __a0=0x1bdb77f8)).*fp(std::__1::forward<>(fp1))) std::__1::__invoke<void (cocos2d::network::WsThreadHelper::*)(), cocos2d::network::WsThreadHelper*, void>(void (cocos2d::network::WsThreadHelper::*&&)(), cocos2d::network::WsThreadHelper*&&) + 74 at __functional_base:383
    frame #11: 0x0106137c Chef Showdown Debug`void* std::__1::__thread_proxy<std::__1::tuple<void (cocos2d::network::WsThreadHelper::*)(), cocos2d::network::WsThreadHelper*> >(void*) [inlined] void std::__1::__thread_execute<void (cocos2d::network::WsThreadHelper::*)(), cocos2d::network::WsThreadHelper*, 1ul>(__t=0x1bdb77f0)(), cocos2d::network::WsThreadHelper*>&, std::__1::__tuple_indices<1ul>) + 20 at thread:347
    frame #12: 0x01061368 Chef Showdown Debug`void* std::__1::__thread_proxy<std::__1::tuple<void (cocos2d::network::WsThreadHelper::*)(), cocos2d::network::WsThreadHelper*> >(__vp=0x1bdb77f0) + 228 at thread:357
    frame #13: 0x2423f85a libsystem_pthread.dylib`_pthread_body + 138
    frame #14: 0x2423f7ce libsystem_pthread.dylib`_pthread_start + 110
    frame #15: 0x2423d724 libsystem_pthread.dylib`thread_start + 8
(lldb)
```

WebSocket LOGD. Crash occurred after the last line:

data.title: Fix various minor typos
data.body: This PR fixes various minor typos in variable names and function definitions.

data.title: [win32] luajit.exe can't be executed on 32bit windows.
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: v3.14.1
- devices test on: Windows 32bit
- developing environments
   - NDK version:
   - Xcode version:
   - VS version:
   - browser type and version:

Steps to Reproduce:

1. 
2. 

Reported at http://forum.cocos.com/t/cocos2dx-3-14-1-pc-cocos-luacompile-64/44897

data.title: lua/luac loading sequence issue
data.body: `LuaStack::executeScriptFile()` find .lua first then .luac, but `cocos2dx_lua_loader()` in `Cocos2dxLuaLoader.cpp`find .luac first then .lua. Should make them load lua fine in the same sequence: find .luac first.

data.title: [ci skip][AUTO]: updating luabinding & jsbinding & cocos_file.json automatically
cocos deploy -p win32 doesn't contain a .exe file
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: v3.14.1
- devices test on: PC (windows 10)
- developing environments
   - NDK version:
   - Xcode version:
   - VS version: VS Enterprise 2015
   - browser type and version:

Steps to Reproduce:

1. run $cocos deploy -p win32 -m release
2. it will create a bin folder with all the correct files but there wont be any .exe
3. you can copy the exe from the  Release.win32 folder into your bin folder to make it work.

data.title: Update submodule reference of cocos2d-console.
data.body: Changed: Solve the error when build Android Studio project on Windows.

data.title: Fix spelling: billborad -> billboard
data.body: This fixes spelling mistakes in the test case `BillBoardTest` to correctly spelled word "billboard".

data.title: CallFunc called twice when wrapped in TargetedAction
data.body:
Title says all.

- cocos2d-x version: 3.14.1  :)
- devices test on: iOS Simulator [iPhone 7 Plus - iOS 10.2 (14C89) ]
- developing environments
   - Xcode version: 8.2.1 (8C1002)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. clone https://github.com/AknEp/TargetedActionExample
2. run in xcode & check output

and, core reproduction is ...

```cpp
# in the Scene ...
this->runAction(TargetedAction::create(this, CallFunc::create([this](){
    CCLOG("Called");
})));
```
"Called" message is printed twice.

```
// with my reproduction code, counter variable is incremented.
myActionB: 0
myActionB: 1
```

Although `TargetedAction` wrapping isn't nessesary in this case, but I met this issue in my real product.

I didn't test other `Action` ( e.g. `FadeIn` ) wrapped in `TargetedAction`. Some `Action` might has same problem.

data.title: make all mesh in view rect
Flag the end of ActionInstant and ActionInterval.
data.body:
Following #17437 and #17545.

This commit adds a flag to `ActionInstant` and `ActionInterval` to mark the end of the action.

`ActionInstant` sets the flag to true only when the action has actually been updated.

`ActionInterval` sets the flag to true only when the elapsed time becomes equal or greater than the action's duration.

`ActionInterval` does not overrides zero durations with `FLT_EPSILON` anymore. Thus a `Spawn` or a `Sequence` of several `ActionInstant` has a duration equal to zero, as expected.

data.title: fixed #17497: Win32 performance is bad.
data.body: The 'Sleep(1)' in FPS controlling code isn't precise enough. Windows sets timer precision from 1ms to 15ms, we need to set the precision to the highest one (1ms). Although it's still not enough, we need to make some tricks in the FPS controlling code, that is, don't sleep if the interval is equal or less than 1 millisecond.

data.title: Updates templates for switching AudioEngine in AppDelegate.cpp.
